TITLE: TikTok is 'digital fentanyl,' incoming GOP China committee chair says
SUMMARY: TikTok is an addictive drug China's government is providing to Americans, says the incoming chairman of a new House select committee on China.

TITLE: World's largest iPhone factory bounces back from Covid disruption that hurt Apple
SUMMARY: Production at the world's biggest iPhone factory, disrupted since October by China's Covid-19 restrictions and worker protests, is now running at nearly full capacity, according to a Chinese state media report.

TITLE: This tech company is clearing out recurring meetings from employee calendars
SUMMARY: One tech company is trying to help its employees kick off the new year with a clean slate, or at least an emptier calendar.

TITLE: Apple has lost $1 trillion in market value in a year
SUMMARY: Apple's market cap fell below $2 trillion in trading Tuesday for the first time since early 2021 and one year to the day after the company became the first public tech company valued at $3 trillion.

TITLE: Twitter sued by landlord for allegedly failing to pay rent
SUMMARY: A commercial landlord is suing Twitter for breach of contract after the company allegedly failed to pay rent for one of its offices in San Francisco.

TITLE: Microsoft gets its first US union
SUMMARY: Developers at a Microsoft-owned gaming studio voted on Tuesday to form the first ever US union at the tech giant, in a milestone moment both for the company and the video game industry.

TITLE: Tom Zhu: Elon Musk's right-hand man at Tesla
SUMMARY: Tesla's China chief has reportedly been given a big promotion.

TITLE: Tech's biggest show is set to kick off in Las Vegas. Here's what to expect
SUMMARY: A new take on a foldable phone. A pricey toilet sensor that monitors hydration and vitamin levels. And an AI-powered oven.

TITLE: Salesforce to cut about 10% of staff
SUMMARY: Salesforce said Wednesday that it will cut approximately 10% of its workforce and reduce its real estate footprint, making it the latest tech company to slash expenses as broader economic uncertainty continues to hit Silicon Valley particularly hard.

TITLE: With its advertising business in crisis, Twitter eases ban on political ads
SUMMARY: More than three years ago, Twitter prohibited political and issue-based ads amid broader concerns that politicians could pay to target social media users with false or misleading information.

TITLE: Apple is raising the price of iPhone battery replacements
SUMMARY: Apple is raising the price of battery replacements for all out-of-warranty iPhone models prior to the current iPhone 14 lineup, the company confirmed on its website.

TITLE: A $3,300 self-driving stroller is at this year's CES. Are parents ready?
SUMMARY: Hang onto your baby bonnets: Self-driving technology is coming to strollers.

TITLE: Amazon CEO says job cuts will continue into 2023
SUMMARY: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said job cuts at the e-commerce giant would continue into early next year, in his first public remarks since the company began widespread layoffs earlier this week.

TITLE: Sony and Honda reveal their car brand, Afeela
SUMMARY: Sony and Honda, which announced a joint venture last year to develop and build electric cars, have revealed the name of their new car brand. It will be called Afeela.

TITLE: Jack Ma's Alibaba, China tech giants are making a comeback post zero Covid
SUMMARY: Chinese tech giants are witnessing a dream start to the year.

TITLE: Sony and Honda reveal their new car brand
SUMMARY: Sony and Honda, which announced a joint venture last year to develop and build electric cars, have revealed the name of their new car brand. It will be called Afeela.

TITLE: How McCarthy's unprecedented leadership battle is a reflection of Fox News and right-wing media
SUMMARY: It's Tucker Carlson versus Sean Hannity in the Republican Party.

TITLE: New York City public schools ban access to AI tool that could help students cheat
SUMMARY: New York City public schools will ban students and teachers from using ChatGPT, a powerful new AI chatbot tool, on the district's networks and devices, an official confirmed to CNN on Thursday.

TITLE: Hackers post email addresses linked to 200 million Twitter accounts, security researchers say
SUMMARY: Email addresses linked to more than 200 million Twitter profiles are currently circulating on underground hacker forums, security experts say. The apparent data leak could expose the real-life identities of anonymous Twitter users and make it easier for criminals to hijack Twitter accounts, the experts warned, or even victims' accounts on other websites.

TITLE: Delta Air Lines is rolling out free Wi-Fi
SUMMARY: Delta Air Lines is rolling out free Wi-Fi to most of its planes beginning February 1.

TITLE: Two months after mass Twitter layoffs, affected employees still waiting for severance offers
SUMMARY: Two months after Elon Musk laid off half of Twitter's workforce, some employees affected say they have yet to receive any formal severance offer or separation agreement.

TITLE: Samsung estimates quarterly profit sank to 8-year low on demand slump
SUMMARY: Samsung Electronics flagged on Friday its quarterly profit tumbled to an eight-year low as a weakening global economy hammered memory chip prices and curbed demand for electronic devices.

TITLE: Inventor of the world wide web wants us to reclaim our data from tech giants
SUMMARY: The internet has come a long way since Tim Berners-Lee created the world wide web in 1989. Now, with his startup Inrupt, he believes it's time for us to reclaim our personal data.
